context: Transition to cloud and all-flash storage era. According to 2014 IDC report, NetApp ranked second in network storage industry Big 5, behind EMC (Dell), and ahead of IBM, HP and Hitachi. Cloud storage and all-flash arrays were disrupting traditional storage models. NetApp launched Cloud Volumes ONTAP to address hybrid cloud needs.

competitors.name: Dell EMC
competitors.notes: Market leader with Unity, PowerMax, and comprehensive storage portfolio following EMC acquisition

competitors.name: Pure Storage
competitors.notes: All-flash storage specialist disrupting traditional storage with Evergreen model, growing rapidly

competitors.name: Hewlett Packard Enterprise
competitors.notes: Major competitor with Nimble Storage and 3PAR all-flash solutions

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Enterprise storage solutions and hybrid cloud strategies

competitors.name: Hitachi Vantara
competitors.notes: Enterprise storage with focus on data management and digital transformation

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Integrated hardware and cloud infrastructure offerings

competitors.name: Nimble Storage
competitors.notes: Predictive all-flash and hybrid flash arrays (acquired by HPE in 2017)

competitors.name: Amazon Web Services
competitors.notes: Cloud storage with S3 and EBS, disrupting traditional storage market
